data.title: Updating the Dependencies submodule
data.body:
Updating the Dependencies submodule to include the new openal-soft library which fixes app crashing issues on Android.

Includes these two pull requests:
https://github.com/KonajuGames/openal-soft/pull/1
https://github.com/KonajuGames/openal-soft/pull/2

@KonajuGames I have tested the latest lib you built on AWS device farm and everything has passed. I believe it's good to merge this into the main repo.

data.title: DirectX: Fixed multisample clamping logic
data.body:
Bigger changes are that I moved some things from `PlatformInitialize()` to `PlatformSetup()` in GraphicsDevice.DirectX.cs. I hope I didn't move too much. Someone please verify as I'm new to this project. 

The reason for this change is that `d3ddevice `is needed before so we can query device capabilities. I compared DirectX version to OpenGL version. GL extension are set inside `PlatformSetup()` and GL Extensions are in some way like d3ddevice .... they are used to query device capabilities. So I tried to mimic OpenGL version. 

Multisample count clamping logic is removed from `GraphicsDeviceManager `and added it to `GraphicsDevice.DirectX` like @Jjagg said in #5449. It should also prevent crashes when multisampling is not supported like PR #5446.

data.title: New or cloned skinned effect will not work
data.body:
Creating a new skinned effect or a clone of a skinned effect using existing effect from a model will not work, only the original effect created as part of the model will work.

I am trying to create a skinned effect at runtime so i dont have to include serialized effect data in all my models. These models use a custom model format. I can create new basic or alpha effects which work ok but when i try to create a new skinned effect it does not work.

Model renders black in a fixed location on the screen. Setting textures, lighting or animation does nothing. Even changing the view or world projects does not change the position on screen where the black model is rendered. I would expect a clone of a working effect to copy all parameters over but maybe some thing is missed out for skinned effects?

The original effect in the model works fine, but only one effect is created for all parts of the model meaning at draw time the textures have to be assigned for every frame drawn.

See also, http://community.monogame.net/t/creating-skinnedeffect-at-runtime-not-working/8744/2

data.title: Get OpenGL tests running and fix the failures (recreated)
data.body:
#5429 for some reason was not getting builds run. It had some issues with the build server before. Hopefully just putting the changes in a new branch solves that.

- fixes #4708, fixes #1449 by throwing if GetData is not called from the main thread (SetData is allowed, but queued and executed synchronously).
- fixes #4224, this might have already been fixed before this branch actually
- fixes #5474, fixes #5473

data.title: Texture2D.GetData<T> does not return the correct number of elements when  size of T is not the same as the pixel format. (OpenGL)
data.body: This is the cause of #5473

data.title: Texture2D.SaveAsImage only writes 1/4th of texture data (DesktopGL)
data.body: When creating a cursor,  MouseCursor.FromTexture2D calls SaveAsImage.  The resulting stream contains only 1/4th of the texture data, and the rest of the stream is zeroed.  A previous version compiled 3 months ago did not have this issue.

data.title: Possibility of multi-song playback
data.body:
As far as I can tell, right now `Song`s can only be played through `MediaPlayer` and only one song at a time. Is there a way to do that?

If not I'd be happy to add the support myself, but I'd need to know if there is any preliminary design done for that.

data.title: Added support for PngWriter to export textures with single surface fo…
data.body:
…rmat using greyscale.

Adds the basic ability to export single channel textures into png format. Extremely useful for generating height maps to be reused later on.

data.title: Pipeline Error on Osx
[DesktopGL] General Fixes
data.body:
Stuff done:
 - Window will no longer get centered after it was moved, this mimics XNA behavior (DesktopGL version of #5467)
 - GL attributes are set before window is created (A proper CreateWindow function when compared to #5445, also I made sure to make it so it can be reused for RecreateWindow with minimal changes later on)

data.title: Do not center window after Position is set
data.body:
Fixes #5460 

When Window.Position is set the window should no longer be centered after it is resized. I also renamed the flag for clarity and moved the window centering code around a bit so it's only needed in 1 place in WinFormsGameWindow itself. 

Looking at this again made me wonder if it would be nice to allow users to reset the flag that's used here so the window is centered again after a resize. We'd change the name and move it to GameWindow for a nice API, `public bool GameWindow.CenterOnResize { get; set; }` or something like that.

data.title: SoundEffect issues (Windows DX, master branch)
data.body:
Hi guys,

I just started working with audio system for my game. I don't use MonoGame pipeline and load all the assets in runtime from their source files. So I'm using these constructors for `SoundEffect` (accepting PCM wave data):
```C#
SoundEffect(byte[] buffer, int sampleRate, AudioChannels channels)
SoundEffect(byte[] buffer, int offset, int count, int sampleRate, AudioChannels channels, int loopStart, int loopLength)
```

However, I've found two issues with the first method (the second method works fine):
1. The sound played much longer than specified, and during the added duration it produces various noise.
2. With some specific effect duration I have a native crash when try to play the sound.

I've created a sample game reproducing the issue. It's very simple - it creates the sine wave (as float[] samples array) and then convert it to the byte array (PCM wave format).
On mouse left button click it plays the sound and writes to the output log (VS output log) how long it was playing: `Sound played duration: 1366.7ms - vs - sound effect duration 680.0ms` (in case of the first method, in case of the second method it's exactly as it should be (if the sample count matches frame rate).
Also there is a line to uncomment `//var samplesCount = 44100;` to test the native crash issue.

You can get the sample game code there https://gist.github.com/aienabled/e0589a23edcb933fba2277c5152041e9 (just create a new MonoGame DX project and replace `Game1.cs` with this file).

Regards!

data.title: ModelTest added to definition file and XNA tests project.
data.body:
Is good to have new tests in main MG project, but is expected to have them in definition file and XNA project file.

Related to #4699

data.title: Fixed UWP resize
data.body:
* GraphicsDevice.Resize was implemented for Windows DirectX only, not UWP or Store Apps.
* Added GraphicsDevice.PlatformValidatePresentationParameters().
* Now one common implementation of GraphicsDevice.Resize. On OpenGL it does nothing but reset render targets.
* Added an empty implementation for GraphicsAdapter.Description in GraphicsAdapter.Legacy.cs.
* GraphicsDevice.cs now has no conditionals for platform-specific code.
* Fixed a XMLDoc warning in XamlGame.cs.

Fixes #5462

data.title: Fix initialization of SwapChain in UWP projects
data.body:
The swapchain from the XAML was being discarded by being set too early in PlatformInitialize. Added PlatformPreparePresentationParameters to allow the swapchain to be set and retained during device creation.

Fixes #5462

data.title: UWP project is broken in newer builds
data.body:
I was previously running a dev version of 3.6 with build # 1365. All was good with my UWP which ran on both Windows 10 and Xbox One.

I recently upgraded to build # 1499, and noticed that my UWP project is now broken. I get the following stack trace when trying to launch the game:

```    		e	{Windows.UI.Xaml.UnhandledExceptionEventArgs}	    Windows.UI.Xaml.UnhandledExceptionEventArgs
-		Exception	{System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.PlatformPresent()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.Present()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGamePlatform.Present()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.EndDraw()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoDraw(GameTime gameTime)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Tick()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGameWindow.Tick()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGamePlatform.<>c.<StartRunLoop>b__12_0(Object o, Object a)}	System.Exception {System.NullReferenceException}
+		Data	{System.Collections.ListDictionaryInternal}	System.Collections.IDictionary {System.Collections.ListDictionaryInternal}
		HResult	-2147467261	int
		HelpLink	null	string
+		InnerException	null	System.Exception
		Message	"Object reference not set to an instance of an object."	string
		Source	"MonoGame.Framework"	string
		StackTrace	"   
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.PlatformPresent()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.Present()  
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGamePlatform.Present()   
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.EndDraw()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoDraw(GameTime gameTime)
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Tick()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGameWindow.Tick()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGamePlatform.<>c.<StartRunLoop>b__12_0(Object o, Object a)"	string
+		Static members		
+		Non-Public members		
		Handled	false	bool
		Message	"System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.PlatformPresent()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.Present()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGamePlatform.Present()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.EndDraw()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.DoDraw(GameTime gameTime)
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Game.Tick()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.UAPGameWindow.Tick()
		at Microsoft.Xna.Framewor"	string
		Native View	To inspect the native object, enable native code debugging.	
```

I went back to the earliest available Windows build which is # 1398 (from the 20th of January), and it's still broken. Note, this error occurs on both Windows 10 and Xbox One.

I *suspect* from looking at the history that this might be related to some changes introduced by @Jjagg on January 6th which looks like it involved a lot of cleanup / refactoring. However, I cannot confirm this since I can't seem to access builds beyond the 20th of January.

Thanks.

Add support for /define:foo=bar

The documentation has an example of this and oddly the code
was in implemented. So I figured we should probably support it :)

data.title: SpriteBatch optimisation: Only calculate projection matrix when viewport changes
data.body:
I was inspired by PR #5456 by @nkast and came up with another related optimisation :) This PR only re-calculates the projection matrix when the viewport changes. Given that the viewport will normally rarely change, this results in a not bad performance boost (takes about 16% less time). It's not quite as good a boost as PR #5456, but decent nonetheless :) Benchmarks (using BenchmarkDotNet): ```c# spriteBatch.Begin(); spriteBatch.End(); ``` Benchmark | Median time | Scale
(Original baseline) | Scale
(PR #5456 baseline) :--- | ---:|:---:|:---: Original code (before PR #5456) | 383.2844 ns | 1.00 | 1.28 After PR #5456 | 299.4846 ns | 0.78 | 1.00 This PR | 253.0242 ns | 0.66 | **0.84**

data.title: Bump Pipeline tool on MacOS to use v4.6.1.
data.body:
This Pr fixes a few issues. Firstly we bump Mac Pipeline tool to target v4.6.1 of mono. This is so that we don't get any build errors about System.Runtime. 
Secondly we include some missing files for the MGCB which we package with the Tool. namely the native libraries such as libnvtt.dylib. 
Finally we create a symlink from the Current mono to 4.6.2. Currently the build bot is on stable (4.6.2) and there is a hard dependency somewhere (i've not found it yet) on that mono. So the easiest solution for now is the use a symlink. 
Once we upgrade the build bot to 4.8.0 (when it goes stable) we will need to revisit this.

data.title: SpriteBatch Begin/End. Do not Multiply with Identity when transformMatrix is null
PInvokeStackImbalance in GL.ClearDepth
data.body:
So we had two developers using the DesktopGL build of MG run into the `PInvokeStackImbalance` debug assist warning when testing their game in the debugger.   

For one it happened on the first call to render a scene.   The other developer was able to render 1000s of frames in the game's UI before getting into gameplay where suddenly `PInvokeStackImbalance` errors started occurring.

For both the error only occurred on `GL.ClearDepth` and for both disabling the `PInvokeStackImbalance` debug assistant feature allows the game to run seemingly like normal.

Still I see information out there that this is a real bug that needs fixing:

 http://codenition.blogspot.com/2010/05/pinvokestackimbalance-in-net-40i-beg.html

But it seems curious that it didn't occur on the first calls to `GL.ClearDepth` for one of the developers.

data.title: Implemention of GraphicsContext
data.body:
Related to #4571.
Note that OpenGL allready had part of GraphicsContext as internal class.

As a proof of concept I moved BlendState.

in GraphicsDevice, a call to this.PlatformApplyX() becomes this.Context.ApplyX().
The code from GraphicsDevice.PlatformApplyX() is moved to GraphicsContext.PlatformApplyX().
Common code and check for Dirty flags is moved to GraphicsContext.ApplyX().

Thoughts?

data.title: Enforce GraphicsProfile.Reach + tests
data.body:
related: #1941

Check:
Texture2D size maximum
TextureCube size maximum
Texture3D size maximum
Nonpower of two Texture2D (mipmap,Compressed)
Nonpower of two TextureCube
Maximum primitives per draw call
DrawInstancedPrimitives()*
IndexBuffer format
Multiple render targets
OcclusionQuery
Texture formats

not tested:
Nonpower of two Texture2D ( TextureAddressMode of Wrap)
Shader Model,
Vertex element formats,
Vertex texture formats,
Render target formats,
alpha blend,
Vertex streams maximum,
Stream stride maximum

https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/shawnhar/2010/03/12/reach-vs-hidef/

data.title: RenderTarget2D constructor broken on Portable Library
data.body:
Consider the following code:

    public static RenderTarget2D CreateRT(GraphicsDevice device)
    {
        return new RenderTarget2D(
            device,
            device.PresentationParameters.BackBufferWidth,
            device.PresentationParameters.BackBufferHeight,
            false,
            SurfaceFormat.Color,
            DepthFormat.Depth16
        );
    }

This code works in a WP8.1 project, but in Portable library it throws an exception:

```
An exception of type 'SharpDX.SharpDXException' occurred in SharpDX.DLL but was not handled in user code

Additional information: HRESULT: [0x80070057], Module: [General], ApiCode: [E_INVALIDARG/Invalid Arguments], Message: The parameter is incorrect.

   at SharpDX.Result.CheckError()
   at SharpDX.Direct3D11.Device.CreateTexture2D(Texture2DDescription& descRef, DataBox[] initialDataRef, Texture2D texture2DOut)
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTarget2D.GenerateIfRequired()
   at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTarget2D..ctor(GraphicsDevice graphicsDevice, Int32 width, Int32 height, Boolean mipMap, SurfaceFormat preferredFormat, DepthFormat preferredDepthFormat, Int32 preferredMultiSampleCount, RenderTargetUsage usage)
```

P. S. The overload with only 3 arguments `(GraphicDevice, int, int)` works fine in Portable. Only constructors with more arguments are affected.

*Update*: here's a working reproduction:
(GitHub says it accepts ZIP uploads but actually doesn't!)

http://spark.ms/tmp/MonoGameFailTest.zip
